description: Borrowed from Ancient Greek ἀστεροειδής (asteroeidḗs), from ἀστήρ (astḗr, “star”) + εἶδος (eîdos, “form”). Analyzable as aster- +‎ -oid

entries.meaning: (zoology) Any member of the taxonomic class Asteroidea; a starfish

description: aster +‎ -oid Coined by William Herschel, terming these objects "star-like". Analyzable as aster- +‎ -oid

entries.meaning: (astronomy) A naturally occurring solid object, which is smaller than a planet, larger than a meteoroid and not a comet, that orbits a star and often has an irregular shape.
(astronomy) In the Solar system, such a body that orbits within the orbit of Jupiter
